elements.title: a train derailment and a six-day disruption (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that fixing a "Null ID" error could have prevented a train derailment and a six-day disruption (pictured)?

elements.title: Michael Gardener (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Michael Gardener preached a sermon in Inuktitut even though he did not yet understand the language?

elements.title: East River Generating Station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the East River Generating Station in New York City was opened by the Queen of Romania?

elements.title: Prince Thagara (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Prince Thagara was so handsome that the future Queen Supayalat disguised herself as a man just to get a glimpse of him?

elements.title: a women's association in Japan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a women's association in Japan used linens hung up to dry to monitor pollution from a nearby power station?

elements.title: the owner of more than 2,000 pornographic films (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the owner of more than 2,000 pornographic films is the most prolific filer of copyright lawsuits in the US?

elements.title: Storer House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The New York Times likened the design of Storer House to The Matrix?

elements.title: Signe Salén (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that physician Signe Salén was denied a pension because she treated fewer than 18,000 patients per year?

elements.title: their calculus books (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Caltech students called their calculus books "Tommy 1" and "Tommy 2"?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
